questions.text: What is 15 x 17?
questions.explanation: 15 x 17 = 255. You can compute this as 15 x 10 + 15 x 7 = 150 + 105 = 255.

questions.text: What is the square root of 144?
questions.explanation: 12 x 12 = 144, so the square root of 144 is 12.

questions.text: What is the value of pi rounded to two decimal places?
questions.explanation: Pi is approximately 3.14159..., which rounds to 3.14.

questions.text: How many sides does a hexagon have?
questions.explanation: A hexagon has 6 sides. The prefix 'hex' means six.

questions.text: What is 2 raised to the power of 10?
questions.explanation: 2^10 = 1024. This is a fundamental value in computing.

questions.text: Who is known as the 'Father of Geometry'?
questions.explanation: Euclid is known as the Father of Geometry for his influential work 'Elements'.

questions.text: What is the sum of angles in a triangle?
questions.explanation: The interior angles of any triangle always add up to 180 degrees.

questions.text: What is the next prime number after 7?
questions.explanation: 11 is the next prime after 7. 8, 9, and 10 are all composite numbers.

questions.text: If a coin is flipped twice, what is the probability of getting two heads?
questions.explanation: Each flip has a 1/2 chance of heads. P(HH) = 1/2 x 1/2 = 1/4.

questions.text: What is the mathematical constant 'e' approximately equal to?
questions.explanation: Euler's number e is approximately 2.71828... It is the base of natural logarithms.

questions.text: Solve for x: 3x + 7 = 22
What is the area of a circle with radius 5?
questions.explanation: Area = pi x r^2 = pi x 25 = 25pi.

questions.text: What is the smallest perfect number?
questions.explanation: 6 is the smallest perfect number. Its proper divisors (1, 2, 3) sum to 6.

questions.text: In a standard deck of 52 playing cards, what is the probability of drawing an Ace?
questions.explanation: There are 4 Aces in a 52-card deck. 4/52 = 1/13.

questions.text: What is the Fibonacci sequence's 7th term, starting with 1, 1?
questions.explanation: The sequence is 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13. The 7th term is 13.

questions.text: What is the name of a polygon with 10 sides?
questions.explanation: A decagon has 10 sides. The prefix 'deca' means ten.

questions.text: What is 7! (7 factorial)?
Which mathematician proved there are infinitely many prime numbers?
questions.explanation: Euclid's proof of the infinitude of primes is one of the most famous in mathematics.

questions.text: What is the mean of the numbers 4, 8, 15, 16, 23, 42?
What is the Golden Ratio approximately equal to?
questions.explanation: The Golden Ratio (phi) is approximately 1.618033... It appears throughout nature and art.

questions.text: What is the hypotenuse of a right triangle with legs 3 and 4?
questions.explanation: By the Pythagorean theorem: 3^2 + 4^2 = 9 + 16 = 25 = 5^2. The hypotenuse is 5.

questions.text: What is the binary representation of the decimal number 13?
How many degrees are in each interior angle of a regular hexagon?
questions.explanation: Interior angle = (n-2) x 180 / n = (4 x 180) / 6 = 720 / 6 = 120 degrees.

questions.text: What is the derivative of x^3?
questions.explanation: Using the power rule, d/dx(x^3) = 3x^2.

questions.text: What is the sum of the first 10 positive integers?
questions.explanation: Using the formula n(n+1)/2 = 10 x 11 / 2 = 55.

questions.text: Which number system uses base 16?
questions.explanation: Hexadecimal uses base 16 with digits 0-9 and letters A-F.

questions.text: What is the least common multiple (LCM) of 12 and 18?
Who developed the coordinate system that bears his name?
questions.explanation: Rene Descartes developed the Cartesian coordinate system.

questions.text: What is the median of the set {3, 7, 9, 15, 21}?
questions.explanation: The median is the middle value of an ordered set. In {3, 7, 9, 15, 21}, the median is 9.

questions.text: How many faces does a dodecahedron have?
questions.explanation: A dodecahedron has 12 pentagonal faces. It is one of the five Platonic solids.

questions.text: What is the GCD (greatest common divisor) of 48 and 36?
What is i^2, where i is the imaginary unit?
questions.explanation: By definition, the imaginary unit i satisfies i^2 = -1.

questions.text: What is the volume of a cube with side length 4?
questions.explanation: Volume of a cube = s^3 = 4^3 = 64.

questions.text: If you roll two standard dice, how many possible outcomes are there?
questions.explanation: Each die has 6 faces. Total outcomes = 6 x 6 = 36.

questions.text: What is the value of log base 10 of 1000?
Which ancient civilization first used the concept of zero as a number?
questions.explanation: Indian mathematicians, including Brahmagupta in the 7th century, were the first to treat zero as a number with defined arithmetic rules.

questions.text: What type of number is the square root of 2?
questions.explanation: The square root of 2 is irrational. It cannot be expressed as a ratio of two integers.

questions.text: What is 25% of 360?
In how many ways can you arrange 4 distinct books on a shelf?
questions.explanation: The number of arrangements is 4! = 4 x 3 x 2 x 1 = 24.

questions.text: What is the name for a triangle with all sides of equal length?
questions.explanation: An equilateral triangle has all three sides of equal length and all angles equal to 60 degrees.

questions.text: What is the standard deviation a measure of?
questions.explanation: Standard deviation measures the spread or dispersion of data values around the mean.

questions.text: Which mathematician is credited with inventing calculus independently alongside Newton?
questions.explanation: Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz independently developed calculus around the same time as Isaac Newton.

questions.text: What is the sum of the interior angles of a quadrilateral?
questions.explanation: The sum of interior angles of a quadrilateral is (4-2) x 180 = 360 degrees.

questions.text: What is the result of 0! (zero factorial)?
questions.explanation: By convention (and for combinatorial consistency), 0! = 1.

questions.text: How many edges does a cube have?
questions.explanation: A cube has 12 edges, 8 vertices, and 6 faces.

questions.text: What is the Pythagorean theorem?
questions.explanation: The Pythagorean theorem states that in a right triangle, a^2 + b^2 = c^2 where c is the hypotenuse.

questions.text: What is the probability of rolling a 6 on a standard die?
questions.explanation: A standard die has 6 equally likely faces, so P(6) = 1/6.

questions.text: What is the circumference of a circle with diameter 10?
questions.explanation: Circumference = pi x diameter = pi x 10 = 10pi.

questions.text: What famous problem did Andrew Wiles prove in 1995?
questions.explanation: Andrew Wiles proved Fermat's Last Theorem, which had been unproven for over 350 years.

questions.text: How many diagonals does a pentagon have?
questions.explanation: Number of diagonals = n(n-3)/2 = 5(2)/2 = 5.

questions.text: What is the value of the expression 3^0?
questions.explanation: Any non-zero number raised to the power of 0 equals 1.

questions.text: What is the mode of the set {2, 3, 3, 5, 7, 7, 7, 9}?
questions.explanation: The mode is the most frequently occurring value. 7 appears three times.

questions.text: Which of these numbers is NOT a prime number?
questions.explanation: 39 = 3 x 13, so it is not prime. The others (31, 37, 41) are all prime.

questions.text: What is the integral of 2x dx?
questions.explanation: The integral of 2x dx = 2(x^2/2) + C = x^2 + C.

questions.text: What is the name for a number that can only be divided by 1 and itself?
questions.explanation: A prime number has exactly two distinct positive divisors: 1 and itself.

questions.text: What is the surface area of a sphere with radius 3?
questions.explanation: Surface area of a sphere = 4pi x r^2 = 4pi x 9 = 36pi.

questions.text: In a normal distribution, approximately what percentage of data falls within one standard deviation of the mean?
questions.explanation: The 68-95-99.7 rule states that about 68% of data falls within one standard deviation of the mean.

questions.text: What is the Roman numeral for 500?
questions.explanation: D represents 500 in Roman numerals. C=100, L=50, M=1000.

questions.text: If f(x) = 2x + 3, what is f(5)?
What shape has 4 equal sides but angles that are not necessarily 90 degrees?
questions.explanation: A rhombus has four equal sides but its angles are not necessarily right angles.

questions.text: What is Euler's identity?
questions.explanation: Euler's identity e^(i*pi) + 1 = 0 is often called the most beautiful equation in mathematics.

questions.text: How many combinations are there when choosing 2 items from 5?
What is the slope of a line perpendicular to one with slope 2?
questions.explanation: Perpendicular lines have slopes that are negative reciprocals. The negative reciprocal of 2 is -1/2.

questions.text: What number does the prefix 'giga' represent?
questions.explanation: Giga represents 10^9, which is one billion.

questions.text: What is the only even prime number?
questions.explanation: 2 is the only even prime number. All other even numbers are divisible by 2.

questions.text: Who introduced the symbol for infinity?
questions.explanation: John Wallis introduced the infinity symbol in 1655.

questions.text: What is the value of sin(90 degrees)?
questions.explanation: sin(90 degrees) = 1. This is a fundamental trigonometric value.

questions.text: How many vertices does a tetrahedron have?
questions.explanation: A tetrahedron has 4 vertices, 6 edges, and 4 triangular faces.

questions.text: What is 3/8 expressed as a decimal?
questions.explanation: 3 divided by 8 = 0.375.

questions.text: Which mathematician is famous for the 'Last Theorem' that took 358 years to prove?
questions.explanation: Pierre de Fermat wrote his famous Last Theorem in the margin of a book around 1637. It was proven by Andrew Wiles in 1995.

questions.text: What is the range of the data set {5, 12, 3, 8, 20, 1}?
questions.explanation: Range = maximum - minimum = 20 - 1 = 19.

questions.text: In modular arithmetic, what is 17 mod 5?
questions.explanation: 17 divided by 5 = 3 remainder 2. So 17 mod 5 = 2.

questions.text: What is the perimeter of a rectangle with length 8 and width 5?
questions.explanation: Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(8 + 5) = 2(13) = 26.

questions.text: What is the mathematical term for a statement that is accepted as true without proof?
questions.explanation: An axiom (or postulate) is a statement accepted as true without proof, serving as a starting point for further reasoning.

questions.text: What is the sum of all angles in a regular pentagon?
questions.explanation: Sum of interior angles = (n-2) x 180 = (5-2) x 180 = 540 degrees.

questions.text: If a bag contains 3 red, 4 blue, and 5 green marbles, what is the probability of drawing a blue marble?
questions.explanation: P(blue) = 4/12 = 1/3. Both B and C are correct as they represent the same value.

questions.text: What is the name of the longest side of a right triangle?
questions.explanation: The hypotenuse is the longest side of a right triangle, opposite the right angle.

questions.text: Which branch of mathematics deals with the study of shapes and their properties?
questions.explanation: Geometry is the branch of mathematics concerned with the properties of shapes, sizes, and positions of figures.

questions.text: What is the value of the expression |-7|?
questions.explanation: The absolute value of -7 is 7. Absolute value gives the distance from zero.

questions.text: How many prime numbers are there between 1 and 20?
questions.explanation: The primes between 1 and 20 are: 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19. That is 8 primes.
